首先我是一个素食主义者，但是又有异食癖。我生理性别为女但是心理性别为男，而且我患有严重的性别认知障碍，我特别胖，但我又常常健身，我又很壮，跨性别意识者、同性恋，同时，还患有残疾，小脚指头不能弯曲，难民出生，小时候遭受过欺凌，有抑郁症，还是穆斯林皈依者、孟德尔杂交实验，不婚主义，但被强迫结婚，女权 婚后遭遇家暴，离婚后独自抚养三个女儿。穆斯林 智商75（和阿甘一样的智商），落第美术生，看了你这个游戏，我试了试，然后抽筋了，你有良心的话就来医院看我，顺便赔我1块钱医药费，外加10000元精神损失费。最后还有一句 暴雪你吗死了

[h1] Good game tainted by incompetent corporations [/h1]

I've played Overwatch since 2017, and it was one of the best shooters available at the time. I had a lot of fun playing with friends, enjoying all the events, climbing the competitive ladder, reading about the universe and creating theories all the time.
 You can dismiss my feelings as nostalgia, but hear me out: 
[list]
    [*]Overwatch started receiving fewer changes each year
    [*]The quality of heroes was lower than ever
    [*]Overwatch League almost lost all their sponsors
[/list]
 Everything about this game was broken and Blizzard just couldn't give a damn about it.

 The next step? Baiting the whole community into thinking they would improve the game, only to release the same game with a economy based on fear of missing out, a shitty matchmaking system, individualize every aspect of the game so that streamers can carry games and make 13 yo Jimmy buy the new Kiriko skin to try doing the same. And now they want you to pay for a "new mode" that previously was available for every player.

I don't believe this game is dying or will die anytime soon, especially now that it's on Steam. However, I wish that everyone getting into it knew what they are dealing with and forced Blizzard to do the right thing this time and don't drop the ball again.

If you simply want a free game you can play with your friends even on console overwatch 2 covers that well.

however

This game relies on an overpriced battlepass for more content (heroes and skins) and is developed by a team that has failed their promise to the community of adding a fleshed out pve mode scraping it more a very dumbed down version. Play tf2 instead.
game of the year
Valve, give us Heavy Update please
Multiple connection issues, having to create a battle.net account, unbalanced Heroes, Not all Heroes unlocked from the start, too much going on and expensive skins. Play cs:go or tf2

I have to say this game is absolute garbage. Now I am not a fan of competitive shooters and this game is the only one I play. I have been playing Overwatch for 6 years and never has it been this bad. Where do I even start.

Cons:
-Matchmaking is ass

-Pay to win. You need to spend real money or play casually (~1h a day for me) for like half the season to unlock a new hero. These heroes are right now meta so new players (and old) not getting them is a massive disadvantage.

-rewards and progression. I WANT LOOTBOXES. They were amazing. free rewards every level and more could be received in events. Now all you can do is dish out 22€... TWENTY TWO euros for a single fucking skin, this shouldn't be the industry standard but a crime. Not only that but they added player levels back after EIGHT+ months and guess what? Old players need to start from square one. I have not gotten anything for my 400h of this game now thanks!

-Ovewatc...Overpromise: The devs promised us PVE story missions, hero mission with skill trees and builds. A re-playable rpg story experience. WOW that sounds good and after 3 years of no content they finally umm scrapped it. Well the steam page does say they are now available but it is only three 20 minute story experiences that us old players have gotten in the past FOR FREE and now they cost 15€? Better yet all those cool customizable abilities are scrapped. Know better and do not spend money on this shit just watch it on yt.

Pros:
-better graphics than in paladins 

-Excellent lore. (Can't play with out paying)

Conclusion is that this game used to be great. I am absolutely disgusted by live service games as they are incredibly predatory and pay to win and Overwatch has become just that. It really does make me sad that microtransactions are profitable, especially when they are mostly skins in a first person shooter. Most people aren't aware of just what the devs promised and how incompetent they are and what we could have had vs what we got. Play this game all you want just consider twice about spending money in it.

EDIT: I have played all the paid missions. They are not very good. The first two are very boring generic shooter missions with nothing separating them from Archive missions. The last one with torb was only fun at the end with the unique turrets. It felt like a actual PVE game and not a shooting gallery. Not worth it at all. There is no depth. its just defend here go here. No unique mechanics that we haven't already seen in other FREE missions. 

Also how does overwatch have Hero progression with no meaningful rewards? PALADINS HAS SKINS TO UNLOCK but OW2 made by blizzard backed by Activation What a waste. 

I have like at least 500 hours (I swear its more but thats what the game says so oh well) on OW1 and played since launch on console before moving over to PC during the content drought between echo's release and OW2 launch. 

Waited 3 years for PVE. They knew it wouldn't be what they showed and said it would be but didn't tell us for like 2 years. No skill trees not a full package yada yada. They released 3 paid missions and 1 free one. I beat the free one in 11 minutes on my first try. Half of the robots were re skinned OW heroes and the other half were original. It was on a base game Ow1 map already used in a archive mission. So even if you enjoy those missions its kinda ridiculous it took them four years to make this. In that time they let Overwatch one wither away with little to no content updates and released a sequel that gave less than if they just continued making content. I like overwatch gameplay honestly even more now. I like 5v5 more than 6v6. I dislike role queue but its fine. The new maps suck IMO. The fact that Hanzo and widow still can one shot is ridiculous. You'd think a game taking so much from Team fortress 2 would understand that sniper characters balanced around the player missing is not fun when they rarely miss. I think the core game play is really fun. However. The lack of polish is sad. Bugs take so long to get fixed. You'd think a dev team mainly focusing on PVP(esp with the lack luster PVE) would patch bugs like the kiriko teleport or the bastion launch scandal a little faster. The skins IMO are lacking and not worth 20-45 dollars.  The "mythic" skins are so lazy. Seriously OW. You are telling me that the genji mythic skin took you people a year to make? No custom reload or animations. Just a voice filter only you can hear? Jesus. The mythic skins suck. its a legendary you can swap tiny pieces of or change the colors. its also FOMO content which is lame.Dude how does paladins have cooler and better skins than you. Anyways about the battle pass. You cannot buy old battle passes and the only give you currency you can buy old OW1 skins with.  The battle pass content is also lame. Its the same characters getting skins with it being full of sprays, banners,and other filler garbage. Its funny to me that most other games can make the battle pass worthwhile and give you the premium currency to either buy it back or buy half of it but poor little OW2 cannot. The devs suck for this game. Most OW2 content creators are negative for a good reason. If you enjoy OW2 and either don't care for PVE or actually enjoy it. I'm happy for you. I'm not saying you cannot enjoy it. It just sucks seeing a once good game make multiple bad choices, Lie to players, drag them along for 2 years while knowing your PVE content will not be what you promised just to slap 3 missions together and charge 15 dollars for them. Maybe those paid missions are amazing. I don't know. I might buy them in the future. I am a glutton for punishment, but the reality is for those of us who waited through the content drought, The lack of new events, the lack of archive missions, the garbage skins, the reduce count of free skins, the stupid reskins of OW1 skins for the lead up to OW2, the lack of polish, the bugs, the lack of bastion for a month. All PVE will ever be is a reminder of is the lies of blizzard. You can't live up to four years if expectations. Especially when you don't deliver on the coolest part,the Skill trees. 

and before someone mentions that they had to get rid of lootboxes because OW1 was not making money. OW1 was making money as far as we know. There is no evidence that it was not making money. Gacha games or Gacha mechanics rely on whales who buy a ton of content making it economically possible There were plenty of whales IMO that def made it worth to update the game. I think in 2020 it made like over a billion dollars. 

If you made it this far, support devs who actually care. Go buy deep rock. Go buy Balders Gate 3.

This is OW 0.2. started the game 90% of the heroes are locked. to unlock my main Doom I need 85 games completed. assuming each game lasts about 10 mins thats 850 mins plus the queue time. Thats over 14Hrs just to unlock a hero. meanwhile there's a handy little pack for 5$ to unlock OW1 heroes lmao they wont even give you everything even if you pay.
PvE mission go for another 15$ thats 20min of shooting mindless bots. all classic OW1 skins are now 10-20$. stuff that you could have preciously gotten for free.  Overwatch league is pretty much dead. The competitive is basically a flip of coin. You either stomp or get stomped because someone in your team doesn't know how to play. wasted of disc space. uninstalled.
Is it better than Overwatch 1? No. but hey at least now when I want to torture myself, i dont need to use their shitty launcher :)

Overwatch was an interesting game at the beginning, really everything you wanted from a team-based shooter,
Then they re-branded it with the 2 to add hype and the promise of a dedicated PvE mode, also added back the original features calling them 'New' not forgetting removing the loot boxes (which despite gambling was a much fairer) and the  over priced skins and a grindy battle pass.
And lets not forget the PvE-lite mode which you have to pay for, so what was the 2 really for? No idea at this point.
All we know for sure is that Team Fortress 2 IS better, its 16 years old, incredibly janky but still a saint compared to this hot mess.
In short, we don't want your shitty business practices or your elitist fanboys on Steam (we have enough), piss off Blizzard!

Pro:

The release on Steam allows for a broader player base to discover and play the game.

Integration of Steam features like achievements can enrich the player experience.

The Steam platform provides an established community for discussions, reviews, and content related to the game.

Con: 

The costs for cosmetic items that were previously obtained for free through lootboxes could frustrate players and be perceived as a money grab.

The transition to paid content could be seen as unjust, as players who have played the game at different times are treated differently.

Reduced gameplay features, this could lead to player disappointment due to the diminished gameplay experience in comparison to Overwatch 1, potentially dampening long-time fans enthusiasm and limiting the game's overall appeal.

Toxic Community (similar to many other games)

Blizzard's controversies
